fields.description:
Currently, two fields can be filled to document what kind of change has been done to a page:

- Comment
- Minor change?

In my opinion, either a page edit is substantial and then the change should be documented in the "Comment" field (to avoid having to use diff to find out what was changed), or it is a minor change, which should be marked as such.

Right now, the default is an empty comment and an unselected "minor change" checkbox. This has the effect that in most cases users mark page edits as major without comment, which is exactly what should be avoided.

Implementing this would also have the effect of making people decide explicitely for each change if it is minor or not, which should improve the correctness of it.
fields.summary: Force either "comment" or "minor change" when editing a page

fields.description:
We want to integrate our confluence with sharepoint server. We are using Sharepoint plugin 1.0.5. And the situation is as follows:

- people in the company are logging in into 2 domains, let say domainA and domainB. They can have identical logins as long as they are not in the same domain.
- confluence authenticates users in domainA
- sharepoint server is domainB, and it has sites with confluence web parts.

- and now, userA in domainA sets restriction to the confuence page "visible only to me"
- userA in domainB can still see the page in sharepoint site (he has the same login, but he is in different domain, it is not the same userA which set restrictions in confluence!)
fields.summary: Confluence sharepoint connector allows to view confluence pages to unauthorized users

fields.description: We would like the Wiki Markup edit screen to be resizable like the Rich Text edit screen already is.
fields.summary: Wiki Markup edit screen is not resizable.

fields.description:
Filing the same issue as CONF-6065 but as an improvement request.

The request is to create a mechanism to prevent different page versions being given the same version number in Confluence.

Despite it being mostly cosmetic, it still affects the functionality when viewing versions and using the "back" and "forward version" functionality.
fields.summary: Duplicated versions in page version history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16374].
  {panel}

Allow users to import their Twitter updates into Confluence, using the #conf tag. After linking your Confluence and Twitter accounts, any Tweet that contains the #conf tag would be automatically displayed in your Confluence status. It would work just like [Yammer|http://blog.yammer.com/blog/2009/03/yammer-integrates-with-twitter.html] where the user:

1. Go to their profile
2. Adds his Twitter username.
3. Add the tag #conf to any tweet that he wants to also share with his Confluence followers.
fields.summary: Import Twitter Updates into Confluence User Status using the #conf tag

fields.description:
jiraissues macro "Fixversion" column renders empty content if there are multiple Fix Version/s selected in JIRA.

The discrepancy is clearly observed by comparing the JIRA issue navigator side-by-side with the output of this macro.  Issues that only have a single Fixversion selected in JIRA render this column correctly.
fields.summary: jiraissues Fixversion column renders empty content if there are multiple Fix Version/s selected in JIRA

fields.description:
After upgrading plugins using the Plugin Repository in Confluence Admin, I get ClassCastExceptions when I click on the "Configure" link next to the plugin once the upgrade is completed. The exception states that casting from a class to itself is not possible.

After a restart of Confluence, the link works as expected. I also get ClassCastExceptions randomly for macros that are provided by updated plugins until I restart the Confluence instance. My assumption is that this is connected to the switch of OSGi as plugin framework because of the fact that the cast from a class to itself fails. This indicates a classloader issue where the class is loaded by two different classloaders as is the case when an OSGi bundle is deployed/undeployed - apparently some classloaders are retained that contain a different version of the class to be loaded or the newly deployed bundle does not get a referenced to the correct class, probably because two other bundles export the same package (just my thoughts, I may be completely wrong here).
fields.summary: ClassCastExceptions after upgrading plugins when trying to click on "Configure"

fields.description:
* Edit a page - enter text 'Edit One'
* Trigger a draft save, and leave the page
* Edit the page again, and this time enter text 'Edit Two'
* Now click on the message about the previous draft version - to 'view the change'


The change shown is 'Edit Two', but it is expected to be 'Edit One'. It is actually impossible to go back to editing the previous draft, as the current draft has now overwritten it.
fields.summary: Viewing the changes for a previous draft will overwrite it before displaying it

fields.description:
* Create a saved draft
* Add a new page - you will see the message about resuming editing or discarding the draft.
* Enter some text in the new page
* Click 'discard'

The confirmation message appears to indicate that you will lose your current page contents. This is not the case - clicking Ok will allow you to continue editing. This could cause confusion for users.

(Obviously the confirmation message should appear if you select to resume editing the draft instead)
fields.summary: Confirmation message is incorrectly seen when discarding a draft while editing

fields.description:
The fix for CONF-13482 means that a new line is entered after selecting a block quote.

This can be annoying for a user as the cursor is moved away from where they have applied the formatting.

* Create new page, and switch to RTE
* Select 'Code' from the formatting dropdown
* Begin typing

The code format is applied to the first line, and the cursor is moved to the second line. This means the typed characters appear underneath the code block, instead of inside it which is what I would expect.

The cursor should remain on the same line as the selected formatting style.
fields.summary: Cursor should remain in place when applying formatting in the RTE
Review new code macro plugin

fields.description:
*Updated description*:

This issue is corrected in version 3.0.1. If you're not ready to upgrade, there are patch instructions below. 

{quote}
I have attached UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.class  that does not produce the exception you have mentioned and moves the page even if it cannot find attachments. You can install it by putting this file under <CONFLUENCE>/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/persistence/dao  directory (you will need to create those directories if they don't exist) and restarting confluence. After that you would be able to move pages that have the 'attachment' problem.

Please test the patch on you development instance before applying it in production. You might also want to rollback the patch once you fixed all 'broken' attachments.
{quote}

Additionally, there's a JSP file that recovers missing attachments if they're stored on the file system. 
The class file attached to the ticket fixes the problem from reoccurring, but does not recover the moved files. Attached is a JSP file that can recover attachments that have been affected by this bug.  

To use it:

# Download the JSP file from the attachments.
# Place it in <confluence-installation>/confluence/admin
# Browse to <base-URL>/admin/find_and_recover_attachments-3.x.jsp

The recovery is self-explanatory from there. You may wish to do this on a [test system|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+Confluence+Between+Servers] first. 

This only works on configurations where files are stored in the file system, not the database. Please respond to this bug report if you need that configuration to be included or if you find any problems with the JSP. 

*Original description*:
Not able to move attachments in a pagetree in Confluence 3.0.0_01.

Customer submitted description:
{quote}
To reproduce:
- create 2 spaces 'test1' + 'test2'
- create 2 pages 'page1' + 'page2' in space 'test1'.  'page2' is a child of 'page1'.
- create a simple text attachment on each page
- go to 'page1' and move it to 'space2'
- open page2 (now also in space2) ... you will see a correct attachment list, but when you try to open an attachment, you will get a message "Attachment File Not Found".

Some notes: 
- page1 keeps its attachment correctly
- If page1 is moved back to space1, attachment content reappears on page2
{quote}

The attachments folders remain in the original folder in the file system but not re-archived following their new page and space hierarchy.

This will be a big pain for customers with big pagetree structure as they will have to move the page one by one in order to keep their attachments intact.
fields.summary: Attachment File Not Found - in children pages when a page is moved to another space

fields.description:
Sometimes when running the parallel build.  The test: com.atlassian.confluence.UserProfileAcceptanceTest.testSettingEmailMaskingToPrivate fails during the early stages. It asserts the admin's email address is shown on the page, but the admin's email address is not admintest@atlassian.com as expected but admin@example.com

This has two likely causes.  The example admin user in the com.atlassian.confluence.it.User object has that email address.  A site import acceptance test may import a site where the admin user has that email address.
fields.summary: Parallel build fails due to incorrect admin email address

fields.description:
With Confluence 3 we bundled the WebDav client. The page on [webdav config|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/WebDAV+Configuration] is for the server. We need one for the client. It can be based on [the existing page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/WebDAV+Client+Setup#WebDAVClientSetup-WebDAVClientSetupMicrosoftNetworkDrive] but should be cleaned up and incorporated into our product documentation. 

As part of this we should decide what client(s) we support for WebDav.
fields.summary: Document how to connect to WebDav

fields.description:
When you try to duplicate an existing page name, there is an error message saying you can't. Sometimes, this error reports the space name, other times the space key. If your space keys relate closely to the space names, this wouldn't be much of a problem. But if the keys are used differently to the space names, this can be a source of user confusion. 

* Duplicate page title with Create Page:  The title <page-name> already exists in space <space-key>
* Duplicate page title with Edit Page:  The title <page-name> already exists in space <space-name>. 
* Duplicate page title with Move Page:  The title <page-name> already exists in space <space-name>.
* Duplicate page title with Copy Page:  The title <page-name> already exists in space <space-key>
fields.summary: Inconsistency between using space name and space key in error messages reporting duplicate page titles
Add comment without page refresh

fields.description:
Due to our licensing changes with Coherence, we must remove it from our non clustered editions of Confluence (now referred to as 'Standard' edition). Ehcache will now be replacing Confluence's caching layer for Standard editions of Confluence. To accommodate for this change, a new 3.0 version of Confluence will be released and available to customers with non clustered licenses. 

For more details see:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/YIHZCw
fields.summary: Build a Standard Edition of Confluence 3.0 (without Coherence)

fields.description:
In Confluence 3, some macros that used to work in the middle of a paragraph now split the paragraph.  See [RNDR-92].
This is to do with the way block and inline tokens are handled during markup rendering, and the value the macros return from isInline().

h3. Description
# The review or track changes function in Word Processor is used to track the changes that have been done to a word document. It can be thought of as the Confluence's _view change_ function. For more information regarding this function, refer to the references section below.
# However, currently the viewfile macro ignores this feature and displays everything that are readable in the document.
# Attached are examples of the current behaviour of the viewfile macro.
# It would be nice if the viewfile macro can show only the latest changes of the file.

h3. References:
# http://support.microsoft.com/kb/305216
# http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/word/HA012186901033.aspx
# http://www.fgcu.edu/support/office2007/word/changes.asp

fields.description:
* Create page 'Page One'

fields.description:
The \{livesearch\} macro appends a wildcard character (asterisk) after the search terms entered.  This is a problem in a number of cases:

# Appending an asterisk to a stemmed word (as in "management") returns far less results than expected: \\ 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5142
# Appending an asterisk to search terms that already end in an asterisk returns zero results
# Appending an asterisk to search terms that end in a phrase (as in "fail whale"*) returns an illegal search string error

In my testing, simply removing the asterisk from the beginning of line 182 of src/main/resources/templates/extra/livesearch/livesearch.js resolves this immediately, as in.

{code}
               livesearchList.liveSearchReq.open(
                       "GET",
                       liveSearchRoot
                               + "/plugins/livesearch/livesearch.action?decorator=none"
                               + "&queryString=" + livesearchform.s.value
                               + "&spaceKey="
                               + livesearchform.spaceKey.value);
{code}
fields.summary: Appending asterisk to search terms causes problems...

fields.description:
Our license agreement with Oracle Coherence says/will say that we put labels onto our documentation indicating that we are using their Software. We will use that label in many places, so probably a usermacro or a include would be smart. We should put it onto pages that clearly/mainly deal with clustering. 

We are not entirely sure what the label should sound like, but it will be along the lines of our old agreement with Tangosol (before they were bought by Oracle):

"Contains Tangosol Coherence™ Technology. Tangosol, the Tangosol logo and Coherence are trademarks or registered trademarks of Tangosol.  Copyright © 2000-2003, Tangosol, Inc.  All Rights Reserved."
fields.summary: Include copyright notice for Oracle Coherence onto our clustering-related documentation

fields.description:
It should *only* display when you are using Clustered. The details about the text/logo will be given to us once we are accepted into the Oracle Partner Network. But a placeholder like 

"This version of Confluence uses copyrighted Oracle Coherence technology" would be a good start to show our good will. "Oracle Coherence" should be a link to their landing page at http://www.oracle.com/technology/products/coherence/index.html

The notice should be small and grey, but clearly visible. According to our old agreement with Tangosol, the label would have been "Contains Tangosol Coherence™ Technology. Tangosol, the Tangosol logo and Coherence are trademarks or registered trademarks of Tangosol.  Copyright © 2000-2003, Tangosol, Inc.  All Rights Reserved.", so we will probably need as much space.

Sometimes theme builder or global configuration settings get lost, possibly due to cache corruption. The knowledge base article has some tracking:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Global+Configuration+Settings+are+Lost

One theory is that a lack of synchronization on this method could be responsible for cache corruption:
DefaultPluginManager.remove()

An additional idea from Adaptavist:
Also on instantiation of the bandana manager have it inject a Boolean into 'com.atlassian.confluence.bandana.debugcheck' into the cache when the map is first created, and have the other bandana methods check for this item's existance then log messages when it's not there?

Both the knowledge base article and this bug report are not reproducible nor confirmed diagnosed.

The 'create space button' macro (which is part of the 'Confluence dashboard macros' plugin) is missing parameters from the macro browser UI.

Whilst addressing CONF-8759, I found that two additional parameters 'width' and 'height' were missing from the current documentation here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Create+Space+Button+Macro

Hence, I've already added this information to the current documentation (i.e. the page link above) and we should now add them to the macro browser UI.

Suggested wording for the macro browser UI is:

* *Pixel Height*
(for {{height}})

* *Pixel Width*
(for {{width}})

No descriptions are necessary.

Any potential ambiguity that these parameters may cause with the {{size}} parameter is covered in the documentation.

fields.description:
On our VQWiki wiki system there is a feature "This topic is mentioned on ..." (followed by list of topic names).
This feature gives you actually the backward navigation inside your wiki structure (you understand what I mean?). While the user created wiki links are for forward navigation, the automatically generated "this topic is mentioned on" links enable the backward navigation. This is extremely useful and used every day here.
In Confluence I can only go back to previously visited topice using the breadcrumb path. Or I have to define my navigation tree manually.

This issue is a copy from https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-33982 where the assignee encouraged me to file this issue here.

Michael

fields.description: If I try to find pages with numeric string, search does not return any hits. For example we need to find pages with IP-numbers (documentation). If I try search with 12.33.456.89, I don't get any results even though this ip-number can be found from multiple pages.
fields.summary: Search does not support numeric search
Networking and confirmation/authorisation

fields.description: There should be an option in the administration console(e.g), to globally switch the context menu for all users on or off. At the moment the function is hard to find, if you do not know where to search for it.
fields.summary: Richt Text Editor - global switch for the context menu

fields.description:
When adding an attachment including a comment, the comment is not saved. Fortunately, adding a comment after the initial upload does work.
Marked as Major, because the user probably does not notice the comment is not saved and hence possible important information about the attachment is lost.
fields.summary: Comment not saved when adding an attachment
